title: Ask CEOs to Step up for Earth by Stepping Down from Trump’s Advisory Council
shortbody: All-of-us must make sure that the others follow these corporate leaders.
body:
Trump’s withdrawal from the Paris Climate Agreement has put him on even thinner ice with companies, and that’s a good thing for all-of-us. Many of the CEOs on Trump’s Advisory Council have made statements in support of the Paris Climate Agreement. But talk can be cheap and so far only two, Elon Musk of Tesla and Bob Igor of Disney, have stepped up by stepping down. All-of-us must make sure that the others follow these corporate leaders.

Here’s how:

  1. See where each CEO on Trump’s Advisory Council stands on climate and to email/tweet at them.

title: Host or Attend a “Call Your Ossoff” Party to Defeat Climate-Change Denying Handel
shortbody: All-of-us must party for our party.
body:
The survival of our only home depends on keeping Georgia on our minds--the Sixth District’s runoff election is on June 20th. Republican Karen Handel cheered when Trump withdrew from the Paris Climate Agreement and said that it “presents an opportunity to do the right thing in the right way.” That is both far right and far wrong.

Now let’s compare that to a far better leader--and one who accepts science. Democrat candidate Jon Ossoff’s response correctly concluded that “If we walk away from our #ParisAgreement commitments to reduce carbon emissions & help fight climate change, history will condemn us for it.”

If we walk away from our #ParisAgreement commitments to reduce carbon emissions & help fight climate change, history will condemn us for it. pic.twitter.com/suP6CdC8EF

— Jon Ossoff (@ossoff) May 31, 2017

To protect our planet from burning up, we need to turn up the heat and support Ossoff. Thanks to Swing Left’s leadership, we are joining forces with Daily Kos, Flippable, Move.On.org, and Progressive Change Campaign (PCCC) to launch a series of Special Election House Parties. If you’ve never done anything like this, don’t worry. Swing Left organizers will hook you up with resources and coordination calls where you can ask questions. All-of-us must party for our party.

Here’s how:

  1. Sign up to host or attend a “Call Your Ossoff” party here.
  2. Support the final stretch of this race by donating to Ossoff’s campaign here.

title: Get the Deets on Impeachment
body:
To impeach or not to impeach, that is the question.

Lordy, Comey’s testimony this week got all-of-us all a flutter about impeachment. But is it the best long-term strategy for our cause?

We don’t have the answer for you quite yet. Like many of you, we are on the fence--mostly because impeachment leads to a President Pence (shudder).

So let’s hold up and study up on the impeachment process. This week we will talk to our resistance allies, do our own research, hear your feedback, and get back to you with our action next week.

Here’s what all-of-us can do this week:

  1. Wrap our brains around the process of impeachment. Check out Indivisible’s guide.
  2. Read Robert Reich’s position, who thinks we should go for it.
  3. Um, not so fast. Check out the argument on the other side of the coin (against/unlikely)
  4. Thanks for those of you who emailed us about impeachment this week--keep sharing your opinions with us at contact@wall-of-us.org.

title: Stop Mitch McConnell From Depriving Millions of Healthcare
shortbody: Keep our eyes on what's happening in Congress.
body:
Meanwhile, back at the ranch, sneaky Mitch McConnell began the procedure Wednesday for fast-tracking Trumpcare to get it to the floor with minimum transparency and maximum pressure.

But our allies at the Center for American Progress are on it. Topher Spiro, Senior Fellow broke it down -- here are the millions of Americans who would lose their coverage under the Senate’s lipstick-on-a-pig of a revised bill:

  • 5.3 million in waiver states
  • 4.3 million older people age 55-64
  • 5.4 million on Medicaid expansion
  • 1 million elderly on Medicaid

All-of-us must make sure that doesn’t happen.

Here’s how:

  1. Use this Trumpcare toolkit to call and tweet at senators in key states.
  2. Retweet this and share it with your friends in targeted states

    Next-level pressure: call your Senator's office and ask for these staffers who deal with health care: pic.twitter.com/RMWUnOvsT5

    — Jon Favreau (@jonfavs) June 9, 2017
  3. Sign this petition from our friends at DailyKos
  4. Follow @TopherSpiro for up to date intel on healthcare.

title: Stand with our Immigrant Families
shortbody: Keep standing with our immigrant neighbors and friends.
body:
As scary as Trump's deportation machine is (and getting scarier, recently extending to DACA youth), allies are coming together at schools, churches, and community locations around the country to stand in solidarity with their undocumented neighbors, friends, and family members. The California Values Act (SB 54) would keep immigrant families together by limiting the use of state and local resources from engaging in deportations and sets a model for the rest of the nation. This week all-of-us must love our neighbors and ally with local groups, support state efforts, and take coordinated action in support of World Refugee Day on June 20.

Here’s how:

title: Keep up The Fight for Ossoff
shortbody: Help Jon get over the finish line a victor.
body:
Ready for some good news? While we’ve been focused on impeachment, things have been going peachy keen for Ossoff in Georgia! After the Tuesday debate, Ossoff emerged the victor against climate-change-denying and planned-parenthood-defunding Handel.

The polls rewarded him with a 7 point lead post debate... But don’t pour the bubbly just yet because his lead means Republicans are going to start pouring money and time to elect climate-change denying and planned parenthood defunding Handel.

All-of-us must keep our sleeves rolled up until the June 20th election.

Here’s how:

  1. Sign up to host or attend a “Call Your Ossoff” party.
  2. Support the final stretch of this race by donating to Ossoff’s campaign here.

title: Put 45 Ways to Resist Trump on Your Summer Reading List
shortbody: Get fired up by one of our progressive allies.
body:
“A majority of Americans have been shocked, dismayed, and disgusted—for good reason—by Trump’s actions since he took office. But we aren’t taking it lying down. Across the United States, the Resistance is growing, as many thousands of patriotic Americans lead the charge against the corrupt and traitorous Trump regime—and the Republican Party that is enabling him.”

For 15 years, Markos Moulitsas, the founder of the Daily Kos, the largest progressive online community, has, figuratively, “written the book” on how progressives can fight back. Now, he’s literally written the book on how all-of-us can fight Trump: The Resistance Handbook: 45 Ways to Resist Trump, out this week. It’s insightful, funny, and chock full of knowledge, resources, and practical advice on how to build, restore, and supercharge our democracy.

What are Kos’ recommendations on how to stay locked in? We’ll give you a preview:

“The key is to make activism—and specifically, actions—a part of your lifestyle. Schedule them into your routine as you would shopping, eating, and breathing. Join organizations, like Wall of Us, that feed you a steady diet of new actions to take. Let this become the new normal; do not let your activism become a Trump-induced anomaly. So find a pace that is sustainable but constant. This will be a lifelong fight.”

All-of-us need a little Kos in our lives now and then to get us fired up for the battles ahead. So check out 45 Ways to Resist Trump online or at an independent book store near you starting June 20.

title: Get the Phones Ringing Again for Healthcare
shortbody: Phones still work poolside. So let's get them going.
body:
As we told you last week, sneaky Republicans plan to vote on a health care bill that they are keeping squirreled away from the public, one that reportedly will take away pre-existing condition protections for millions of Americans. Word on the street is that calls to the Senate regarding the ACA and the AHCA have dwindled to normal call levels after the unprecedented deluge of calls around Trump’s inauguration.

We know it is summer. It's easy to get distracted by mint juleps and balmy nights. But it’s time to kick it up into high gear again and pick up the phone. Every single senator has a legislative assistant dedicated to healthcare. Let’s make sure they hear from all-of-us this week and every week until we know our healthcare is secure.

Call your Senators' offices. Use this list of aides compiled by our friends at Indivisible.

title: All in on Climate
shortbody: Time to tell the world that we are still in.
body:
All-of-us are still in on climate, even if Trump is out.

In the absence of federal leadership on climate, governors, mayors, businesses, and universities across the country are stepping up to work toward the goals of the Paris Agreement. They are still in, and we are too. All of us must tell the world and our leaders at all levels of government that we support the Paris Agreement and stand in the fight against climate change.

Join the thousands of cities, states, organizations and citizens and show that you’re still in.

title: You Are Invited to a Summer Social by Wall-of-Us and Moveon.org!
shortbody: Let's meet offline to make our resistance stronger.
body:
Since November, all-of-us have been engaged in peaceful resistance to the dangerous rhetoric and actions of the Trump administration and the GOP. You’ve marched, protested, called, written, and otherwise stood up. While it’s been our privilege and joy to be part of your online journey, we also are committed to supporting you offline, and helping you to unplug and recharge.

Based on your input and working with partner Moveon.org, we are excited to announce our first in person invitation to all-of-you. Please take a moment and celebrate what we’ve achieved — and recharge for the work ahead — by attending a summer social gathering the weekend of June 25 or July 2. Wall-of-Us will be holding its own event as well, on the afternoon of June 25, in Oakland. If you’re in town, please join us!

  1. Find a local summer social near you and attend it. Bay area friends, we welcome you at our event.
  2. If you can’t find an event, host your own!

title: Stop Mitch and His Buddies from Killing Americans
shortbody: We can't let them pass Trump(don't)Care.
body:
Mitch McConnell and 12 other male GOP senators unveiled the Trump(don’t)Care bill on Thursday. The bill was written in secret, but it’s no surprise that it steals healthcare from the poor to give tax breaks to the rich. For all of the reasons explained in this article, it is a tough bill to swallow. But don’t lose hope--the Democrats are united, which means Republicans can only afford to lose two votes. There are already five GOP senators who are opposing it outright.  

Let’s break it down.

These 4 Republican senators on the far right believe that the bill doesn’t go far enough in repealing Obamacare. Wow. But yay!

Ted Cruz (Texas)
Ron Johnson (Wisconsin)
Mike Lee (Utah)
Rand Paul (Kentucky) 

On Friday, Senator Dean Heller of Nevada, who is considered a moderate Republican said that he cannot support a bill “that takes insurance away from tens of millions of Americans and hundreds of thousands of Nevadans”.

In addition to these five there are other GOP senators voicing concerns including the following: 

On the grounds that the bill cuts funding from Planned Parenthood
Susan Collins (Maine)
Lisa Murkowski (Alaska)

On the grounds that the bill cuts Medicaid funding to curb the opioid epidemic
Shelley Moore Capito (West Virginia)
Rob Portman (Ohio)

The Republicans want to vote on the bill before the July 4th recess. All-of-us must stop this bill. 

Here’s how:

  1. Use Indivisible’s Trump Care Ten Guide to contact your Senator, make an amendment, and publicize the impact on your state. It works for even those of us in blue states with actions and tools that target key red states.
  2. Sign these petitions.

title: Say Their Names
body:
#BlackLivesMatter

Philando Castile. Alton Sterling. Michael Brown. Amadou Diallo. 12-year old Tamir Rice. And just week, Charleena Lyles, a pregnant Seattle woman. Each was a precious human being - Philando, a beloved son, brother, boyfriend and cafeteria worker who served hundreds of children; Alton, a beloved father of five, nephew, and son known in his Baton Rouge community as "CD Man"; Michael, a college-bound 18 year old beloved by his parents, family and friends; Amadou, a beloved 23-year-old son and Guinean immigrant who aspired to be computer programmer; Tamir, a beloved 12-year old son, brother and sixth grader who loved to swim, draw, and play basketball; Charleena, a beloved mother of four - shot to death by the police.

In each case the officer was not charged. Why? Because the legal standard established by the Supreme Court in Graham v. Connor is that reasonable use of force by an officer must be viewed from the perspective of what appeared reasonable in the moment of its application - not 20/20 hindsight. Or, as Trevor Noah said this week on the Daily Show: “What they are basically saying is, that in America, it is officially reasonable to be afraid of a person just because they are black.”

This week all-of-us must fight for criminal justice reform by recognizing every black family affected by these killings.

Here's how:

  1. Sign Color of Change's petition to halt severance talks between Philando Castile’s killer and the police department that hired him, and to get alerts from Color of Change.
  2. Go deeper. Check out Shaun King’s series on police brutality.

title: Chin Up and Keep Fighting
shortbody: Chins up, y'all. It ain't over.
body:
“Float like a butterfly sting like a bee – his hands can’t hit what his eyes can’t see.”

It’s true-we lost all four of the special elections this year, and those punches hurt. But let’s rise above the current pain and get our eyes on the big picture. Remember that each of these seats were cherry picked by Trump because they were in “safe” Republican districts. The fact that we got close to winning seats in these deeply red states means that there is no such thing as a safe red district because of all-of-us. We are getting increasingly organized and focused, and by the 2018 elections, when we do what we did in Georgia across the country, at least 52 House Republicans will lose. It’s going to be awesome--but we have to keep our eyes open and hearts in the fight.

Here’s how:

  1. Read this article about how the special elections still paint a good picture for Democrats. (5 mins)
  2. Take a walk and listen to this podcast from our friends at FiveThirtyEight, who give the bigger picture and historical perspective. (25 mins)
  3. Read this article by Steve Phillips, founder of Democracy in Color, and get pumped up when you see that our base is growing. (5 mins)

title: Give Wall-of-Us $ome Love
shortbody: Give us some love to keep up the fight.
body:
“I may not have a lot to give,
But what I've got I'll give to you.
I don't care too much for money,
Money can't buy me love.”

We hope you love what we are giving you as much as we love giving it.

It’s true, we are lovers -- but we are also fighters. And we want to give you more potent, localized, personalized actions, and support and grow the resistance. That requires more than love. It requires research, development, time, and well, money. We need all-of-your support to keep going and growing.

Here’s how you can give us the love to keep up the fight:
Make a one-time donation or sign up to give us a monthly donation

Our goal is to make your activism easier, more impactful, and more rewarding.

title: Keep Resisting Trump(Don’t)Care (...it’s working!)
shortbody: Let’s show the GOP some fireworks this recess.
body:
Nice work! The Wall-of-Us we built stopped mean Mitch McConnell from jamming Trump(don’t)Care through before the July 4th recess. We dealt a blow, and now we need to kill the bill that would, if passed, kill Americans. But Senate Republicans aren’t giving up--they have applied lipstick to a pig and sent the Congressional Budget Office outlines of a “revised” bill for review. As we head into the July 4th recess, the momentum is on our side--McConnell doesn’t have the votes, and all-of-us must keep it that way. Let’s show the GOP some fireworks this recess.  

Here’s how: 

  1. Read this brief summary from Axios on the current state of play. (1-2 minutes)
  2. If you are a medical professional, check out the House Calls Campaign. If you are not, share widely!
  3. Brush up on the deets for how Trump(Don’t)Care would affect your state here. (1-2 minutes)
  4. Visit your senators during the July 4th recess. You can see if they are holding Town Halls here and use these sample questions.
  5. Can’t visit--then call your senators using the info and scripts below:

title: Show Luv to the Guvs Who Stood Up for Healthcare
shortbody: All-of-us must have their backs and ask them to have ours.
body:
"While we certainly agree that reforms need to be made to our nation’s health care system, as Governors from both sides of the political aisle, we feel that true and lasting reforms are best approached by finding common ground in a bipartisan fashion.”

Seven bi-partisan governors wrote in their letter to Senators McConnell and Schumer. This week, all-of-us must thank the governors who spoke out against Trump(Don’t)Care, and to ask our own Governor to step up if they haven’t. It’s not easy to oppose a President who revels in punishing his enemies – like steering infrastructure funding to states whose governors stayed quiet or support the AHCA. We need to make sure these governors know we have their backs and ask them to have ours.

Here's how all-of-us can show some Guv Luv:

  1. Read about how bi-partistan governors are stepping up around the country and why it matters here. (5 minutes).
  2. No matter what state you are in, call Governor McAuliffe (Virginia) and Governor Baker (Massachusetts) who lead the National Governors Association (NGA) and thank them for their letter to Senator McConnell insisting states have more time to review the impact of the bill. 
  3. Call your Governor. Find contact information, your Governor’s position and a script below:

title: Pledge Our Allegiance to Each Other
shortbody: Renew our commitment to our country and our fellow countrymen and women.
body:
As you get ready to fire up your grills this Tuesday, take a minute to reflect on your commitment to our flag and our country. On Inauguration Day, many of us took an oath to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution that we have lived on a weekly basis. Independence Day presents another opportunity to renew our commitment to the country that we love. The Presidential election, rise in hate crimes, and lack of communication across social and political lines have divided this country. But together with our neighbors, all-of-us must take back our flag and pledge our allegiance to each other, and to the values of tolerance, understanding, justice and freedom for all. We are partnering this week with the People's Supper to offer you a pledge you can say out loud, as well as to live, by attending or host a supper near you.

Here's how:

Say and sign the Pledge of Allegiance to Each Other, a campaign for the 4th of July and beyond. (2-minutes)

Join or host a supper near you. (1.5 -3 hours)
